fi.tuni.coudini.lotto.util

Class Arrays

  • java.lang.Object
    • fi.tuni.coudini.lotto.util.Arrays

  • public class Arrays
extends java.lang.Object
    The class Arrays contains methods that receive arrays as arguments. This class is meant to be updated and more methdods added into it over time.
    Author:
    Toni Salminen

      • contains

        public static boolean contains(int value,
                               int[] array)
        Checks if a value is found within the array.
        Parameters:
        value - value that is searched for within an array.
        array - array where a value is searched from.
        Returns:
        true or false depending if argument is found in the array.

      • containsSameValues

        public static int containsSameValues(int[] array1,
                                     int[] array2)
        Counts how many values in given arrays are the same.
        Parameters:
        array1 - array that is compared with the other array.
        array2 - array that is compared with the other array.
        Returns:
        the amount of values that are same.

      • removeIndex

        public static int[] removeIndex(int[] original,
                                int index)
        Generates a new array from an array received as an argument excluding the original array's [index].
        Parameters:
        original - array where a value on [index] is removed from.
        index - [index] that is to be removed from an array.
        Returns:
        array generated from original array.

      • sort

        public static int[] sort(int[] array)
        Sorts an array in an ascending order.
        Parameters:
        array - array to be sorted.
        Returns:
        sorted array.

      • prefixZero

        public static java.lang.String[] prefixZero(int[] original)
        Converts the array from int type to String type. Automatically prefixes zero's before the values in an array depending on the length of the longest string of numbers.
        Parameters:
        original - original array.
        Returns:
        prefixed String array.

      • prefixZero

        public static java.lang.String[] prefixZero(int[] original,
                                            int zeros)
        Converts the array from int type to String type. Prefixes zero's before the values in an array depending on the number of zero's and the length of the longest string of numbers.
        Parameters:
        original - original array.
        zeros - amount of zero's to add.
        Returns:
        prefixed String array.
